# Draft:Social Networking Forum

----
Social Networking Forum (SNF) is a non-profit organization based in Nashik, Maharashtra, India, working to address water scarcity, education inequality, and healthcare gaps in tribal and rural areas. Founded by social worker Pramod Gaikwad in 2014, SNF has undertaken various development initiatives, especially in remote tribal villages of Maharashtra.https://www.loksatta.com/nashik/water-18-villages-through-social-networking-pramod-gaikwad-a333/
Background
The Social Networking Forum was founded as a youth-driven movement using social media to mobilize volunteers and address systemic issues in underserved communities. The organization was formally registered under MH 3041-N and F-15525-Nashik and began focused operations in health, education, and water management.
Key Projects
Water Access
SNF implemented drinking water systems in more than 35 tribal villages, helping them become tanker-free.https://twocircles.net/2019jan05/428225.htmlhttps://www.loksatta.com/nashik/nashik-water-problem-of-taklachi-wadi-barichi-wadi-to-be-resolved-soon-initiative-of-social-networking-forum-help-from-thane-based-organization-ssb-93-5099630/ These efforts were reported in regional and national media such as Times of Indiahttps://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/nashik/social-media-takes-stance-in-solving-malegaons-water-problem/articleshow/58200557.cms and Zee 24 Taas.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nIxAqsQIm5Y
Library Movement
The organization established 29 rural libraries in tribal areas of Nashik to provide access to books, academic materials, and competitive exam resources.https://www.lokmattimes.com/maharashtra/nashik-rural-library-initiative-aims-to-empower-tribal-students-amid-educational-challenges-a505 Reports indicate that over 100 students have benefited and secured public service positions through these centers.https://divyamarathi.bhaskar.com/local/maharashtra/nashik/news/25-villages-made-tanker-free-15-libraries-established-much-more-social-networking-forums-pramod-gaikwad-named-outstanding-citizen-130039631.html
Health and Nutrition
SNF organized health camps in tribal schools, performing blood group tests and anemia screening, and distributed food to malnourished children.https://www.lokmat.com/nashik/social-networking-forums-help-hand/
Kashmir Goodwill Support
Since 2020, SNF has collaborated with Indian Army Goodwill Schools in Kashmir to support education and integration activities. SNF’s contributions included school materials, classroom repairs, and support during COVID-19.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b911WOeXKP0
COVID-19 Relief
During the pandemic, SNF distributed PPE kits, food packets, and medical supplies in rural Maharashtra.https://www.loksatta.com/nashik/social-networking-forum-protect-the-corona-warriors-akp-94-2490711/
Media Coverage and Recognition
The Forum's work has been documented across Indian media outlets:
"Social Media Steps In to Solve Malegaon’s Water Crisis" – Times of Indiahttps://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/nashik/social-media-takes-stance-in-solving-malegaons-water-problem/articleshow/58200557.cms
Interview on Bharat Bhagya Vidhata, News Dankahttps://www.newsdanka.com/videos/bharat-bhagya-vidhata/interview-of-pramod-gaikwad-of-social-networking-forum-for-bharat-bhagya-vidhata/57743/
Loksatta, Maharashtra Times, Lokmat, and Zee 24 Taas have regularly reported on SNF’s progress
